content:
You can use the icacls command to give full permissions to a file for a specific user. The command would be in the following format:

icacls "filepath" /grant "username":(F)

For example, if you want to give full permissions to the file C:\example.txt for the user hacker, the command would be:

icacls "C:\example.txt" /grant "hacker":(F)

Note that you need to run this command as an administrator in order to have sufficient permissions to modify the file's permissions.
